p: Table 4 displays the effects of TEO on semen characteristics. Results demonstrated that TEO increased the sperm livability, sperm motility, and ejaculate volume compared with PC and NC groups at the end of treatments. Abnormal sperm was reduced ( P < 0.01) as TEO increased, compared to PC and NC groups. Moreover, supplementation of TEO up to 180 mg/kg to male rabbit diets remarkably increased ( P < 0.001) sperm forward motility% and sperm livability% in comparison with control groups. However, no significant difference was observed in the semen pH values between treatments. Overall, the PC (oxytetracycline) exhibited a significant increase in semen quality compared to NC.
